text: Philipp Grubauer (born 25 November 1991) is a German professional ice hockey goaltender for the Seattle Kraken of the National Hockey League (NHL). He was drafted by the Washington Capitals in the fourth round in 2010. Grubauer has played with the German national team. Grubauer won the Stanley Cup as a member of the Washington Capitals in 2018. In April 2015, while playing for the Capitals, Grubauer became the first German-born goaltender to start and win a Stanley Cup playoff game. ==References== Category:1991 births Category:Living people Category:Seattle Kraken players Category:Washington Capitals players Category:Colorado Avalanche players Category:German ice hockey players
title: Philipp Grubauer
